body:
r? @alexcrichton

(rust_highfive has picked a reviewer for you, use r? to override)

The rest of the PR looks fine to me. Please rename the PR to indicate that the main thing is adding the OpAssign implementations. Also note that the PR title is not included in bors' merge log, so I recommend just copying the title line to the first line of the PR message too.

Thanks! Note that the discussion in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/27755 is not done yet, but it will recommend removing OverflowingOps as a trait. Touching it here doesn't change much, so it seems fine.
Thanks, looks good to me! Could you also squash the commits into one?
This needs the `[breaking-change]` tag in the commit log for the removal of `pub` on the functions in std::num::wrapping.
Is this good to go?
@sfackler sorry, almost... I wanted to add some more impls.
@sfackler unless you can think of anything more, I think it's done now, although obviously it needs a rebase.
The `Wrapping<T> + T` operations are fine with me, but what does the libs team think? (If there's been discussion already I must have missed it).
I suggested the same thing [here](https://internals.rust-lang.org/t/ergonomics-of-wrapping-operations/1756/43?u=glaebhoerl) and people raised some valid points in response.

@bluss @glaebhoerl We don't `impl T + Wrapping<T>`, only `Wrapping<T> + T`. The issue is one of ergonomics, and there's no arguing that `Wrapping<T> + T` should not output a `Wrapping<T>` and wrap. Our current way of doing things is _awful_; we _need_ to fix it.
@bors r+

:pushpin: Commit 165f5da has been approved by `eddyb`

<!-- @bors r=eddyb 165f5da40ec2c9a93f37f230e4c4ad515e8bd9c0 -->
:hourglass: Testing commit 165f5da with merge 68d1928...
:broken_heart: Test failed - [auto-mac-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-64-nopt-t/builds/7592)
@bors @eddyb I found a bug with these new tests! :D
@sfackler No, because we need to handle differently sized and signed types.
@glaebhoerl thanks for the ping. I'm not sure I understand the issue. Will have to wait until I get to my PC.
Yes, we need to have a discussion about the mixed operands.

@glaebhoerl @llogiq I... just realized that `Wrapping<T>` is not unstable. I have no idea why I thought that. I'm going to do a different PR for the `Add(Assign)?<T> for Wrapping<T>`, so that there can be discussion there about it.
@bors r+

:pushpin: Commit 402259d has been approved by `eddyb`

<!-- @bors r=eddyb 402259da38adee9c5a1dca67489e022c4628dfa8 -->
:hourglass: Testing commit 402259d with merge 50726c1...
:broken_heart: Test failed - [auto-mac-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-64-opt/builds/7571)

FWIW I don't think `Wrapping<T> += T` is problematic -- there's really only one way it could behave and that behavior doesn't seem the least bit surprising -- but I'll let others weigh in (and there's no harm in delaying it, either).
@bors retry
:hourglass: Testing commit 402259d with merge 5e8cb38...

:sunny: Test successful - [auto-linux-32-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-32-nopt-t/builds/7588), [auto-linux-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-32-opt/builds/7606), [auto-linux-64-debug-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-debug-opt/builds/862), [auto-linux-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-nopt-t/builds/7544), [auto-linux-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-opt/builds/7564), [auto-linux-64-x-android-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-x-android-t/builds/7547), [auto-linux-cross-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-cross-opt/builds/772), [auto-linux-musl-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-musl-64-opt/builds/2725), [auto-mac-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-32-opt/builds/7616), [auto-mac-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-64-nopt-t/builds/7608), [auto-mac-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-64-opt/builds/7574), [auto-win-gnu-32-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-gnu-32-nopt-t/builds/2578), [auto-win-gnu-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-gnu-32-opt/builds/2592), [auto-win-gnu-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-gnu-64-nopt-t/builds/2594), [auto-win-gnu-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-gnu-64-opt/builds/2574), [auto-win-msvc-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-msvc-32-opt/builds/1826), [auto-win-msvc-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-msvc-64-opt/builds/2574)
